Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Clock, Mallet, Mole, Scoreboard, ScoreBubble, Seat

    public class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a superclass for all entities that are present in the game outside basic utility objects such as buttons or backgrounds. This class encapsulates a Sprite object for creating animations, a Transform object for tracking the location and velocity of an object in game, and a BoxCollider which is used to determine if an object has made contact with a point in the game world's plane.

    • Method Detail

      • setSprite

        public void setSprite(Sprite sprite)
        Sets the sprite for the GameObject

      • getBoxCollider

        public BoxCollider getBoxCollider()
        Returns:
        the member variable that represents a box surrounding the GameObject's sprite, used for collision detection

      • getTransform

        public Transform getTransform()
        Returns:
        the member variable responsible for tracking the location of the GameObject and its velocity

      • getSprite

        public Sprite getSprite()
        Returns:
        the member variable that contains the object that displays and animates the GameObject

      • insideBoxCollider

        public boolean insideBoxCollider(float x,
                                 float y)
        Tests whether or not a point is inside the GameObject's BoxCollider
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the point you are testing to see if it is inside the BoxCollider
        y - the y coordinate of the point you are testing to see if it is inside the BoxCollider
        Returns:
        the method returns true if the point is inside the BoxCollider and false otherwise

      • update

        public void update(long elapsedTime)
        Updates the x and y coordinates of the transform and the temporal location (spot in animation) of the sprite.
